revision.text:
{{Infobox officeholder | honorific-prefix = | name = Alexander Fyodorovich Roediger | native_name = Алекса́ндр Фёдорович Ре́дигер | native_name_lang = ru | image = Alexander Rediger.jpeg | office = [[Ministry of War of the Russian Empire|Russian Minister of War]] | term_start = 15 July 1905 | term_end = 11 March 1909 | monarch = [[Nicholas II]] | primeminister = | predecessor = [[Viktor Sakharov]] | successor = [[Vladimir Sukhomlinov]] | office2 = [[Ministry of Defence (Bulgaria)#List of ministers|Bulgarian Minister of War]] | term_start2 = 19 September 1883 | term_end2 = 26 October 1883 | monarch2 = [[Alexander of Battenburg|Alexander I]] | predecessor2 = [[Alexander Kaulbars]] | successor2 = [[Viktor Kotelnikov]] | birth_date = {{OldStyleDateDY|12 January|1854|31 December 1853}} | birth_place = [[Veliky Novgorod]], [[Novgorod Governorate]], [[Russian Empire]] | death_date = {{Death date and age|1920|01|26|1854|1|12|df=yes}} | death_place = [[Sevastopol]], [[Crimean ASSR]], [[Russian SFSR]] | nationality = Russian | alma_mater = [[General Staff Academy (Russia)|Nikolayev Academy of the General Staff]] <!--Military service--> | allegiance = {{flag|Russian Empire}} | branch = [[File:Coat of arms Kolchak 1919.jpg|18px]] [[Russian Imperial Army]] | serviceyears = 1870s—1917 | rank = [[General of Infantry]] | unit = | commands = | battles = [[Russo-Turkish War of 1877-1878]] | mawards = }} '''Aleksandr Fedorovich Roediger''' ({{lang-ru|Алекса́ндр Фёдорович Ре́дигер}}; {{OldStyleDateDY|12 January|1854|31 December 1853}}, [[Veliky Novgorod]], [[Novgorod Governorate]], [[Russian Empire]] – 26 January 1920, [[Sevastopol]], [[Crimean ASSR]], [[Russian SFSR]]) was a Russian [[General of Infantry]] who fought in the [[Russo-Turkish War of 1877-78]], served as a member of the [[State Council (Russian Empire)|Imperial Russian State Council]], and was the [[Ministry of War of the Russian Empire|Minister of War]] of the [[Russian Empire]] (1905–1909). He also briefly served as the [[Ministry of Defence (Bulgaria)#List of ministers)|Minister of War]] of the [[Principality of Bulgaria]] (1883).
== Biography == Graduate of the [[Page Corps]] and a student of the [[General Staff Academy (Imperial Russia)|Nicholas Academy of the General Staff]]; served in the [[Russo-Turkish War of 1877-1878]]; in 1882 was appointed Assistant Minister and later Minister of War of the newly independent Principality of Bulgaria; on his return to Russia became a Professor in the Nicholas Military Academy. He was appointed Assistant Minister of War of Russia in 1898 under [[Aleksey Kuropatkin]]. Served as Russian Minister of War from 1905 through 1909 serving in the Witte, Goremykin and Stolypin governments. He was also an appointed member of the Imperial State Council beginning in 1905. In June 1907 police foiled a plot to assassinate Roediger. Several members of [[Socialist-Revolutionary Party]] were arrested.
== References== * Out of My Past: Memoirs of Count Kokovtsov; Hoover War Library Publications Number 6, Stanford University Press, 1935. * [http://query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=F00F12FC3B5E12738DDDAC0894DF405B858CF1D3 NEW RUSSIAN WAR MINISTER.; Gen. Ridiger Is Appointed to Succeed Gen. Sakharoff.] * [http://query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=F60A14FC345417738DDDA10A94DF405B878CF1D3 PLOT TO KILL RUDIGER.; Police Discover Conspiracy to Murder Russian War Minister.]
